title: Utility EDF warned of a 24-hour strike starting Monday September 23
text:
FILE PHOTO: The logo of Electricite de France SA (EDF) is pictured on the facade of a building in Paris, France, August 5, 2018. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau

PARIS (Reuters) - French utility EDF (EDF.PA) said it had received notice of a 24-hour strike starting on Monday Sept. 23 at 1900 GMT.

The state-controlled utility did not specify if the national strike would curb electricity generation.

The strike was called by the CGT, one of EDF’s main trade unions.

A strike by EDF unions in protest over a planned restructuring of the company cut French electricity production by over 10% last week. The unions have demanded that the government drop the plan to restructure the company by Oct. 10, or they will call another strike.
description: French utility EDF said it had received notice of a 24-hour strike starting on Monday Sept. 23 at 1900 GMT.
